page.title: 17FARMING
page.content:
{ { {MY DAD'S WORK. By Robert BARONS.
Today my Dad is silaging and he is using a JOHN DEER 4 wheel drive pulling the silage wagon and a INTERNATIONAL tractor draying trailers and a Ford buck raking. When you are silaging you cut the grass,then you hay turn it,then you leave it for a while if it is wet, then get the tractor and the foridger and the silage wagon and collect it up. When you are hay making you do the same thing but you leave the grass to brown off, then you get the hay turner to turn it over, then let that brown then get the baler and make it into bales.Then you just put them on the trailers and stack them in the shed.
